trs: These monkeys, this is how they are!' [Thieving monkeys]

src: kʊʊ-nongwa j-\textbf{aa} \textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{tɪ} Juma a-a-meenye ʊkʊtɪ Sambʊka m-manyaani gw-a Asia, po a-lɪnkw-itɪk-a ʊ-kʊ-bʊʊk-a kʊ-kʊ-many-a=ko kʊ-my-ake

src: Mfyage a-a-bʊʊk-ile kʊ-n̩-ganga ʊ-gw-a kɪ-tiitʊ, kʊ-kʊ-lond-a ʊ-n-kota ʊ-gw-\textbf{a} \textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{tɪ} ba-n̩-gan-ege fiijo a-ba-nyambala
trs: Mfyage went to a witch doctor to find a medicine that would make men love her very much.' [Mfyage turns into a lion]

src: Saliki a-lɪnkʊ-tɪ \textup{\lq\lq}ʊ-m̩-buut-ile kalʊlʊ ʊ-jʊ n-d-ile ʊ-buut-ege?\textup{''} ʊ-n-kasi gw-a Saliki a-lɪnkʊ-tɪ \textup{\lq\lq}keet-a ʊ-t-ile \textbf{baatɪ} n-heesya gw-ɪtu!? n-um̩-buut-iile ɪ-n-gʊkʊ. a-li=mo n-nyumba, a-lɪ pa-kʊ-ly-a=mo\textup{''}
trs: Saliki said ``Have you slaughtered Hare, whom I told you to slaugher?'' Saliki's wife said ``Look, you said he is our guest!? I slaughtered a chicken for him. He's in the house, he's eating.''{}' [Saliki and Hare]
\lq [Quoting:] \lq\lq I'd like a Coke.''{}' [overheard]

src: \textup{\lq\lq}fi-ki?\textup{''} \textup{\lq\lq}a-fw-ile ɗaaɗa gw-ake\textup{''} \textup{\lq\lq}n-koolel-e!\textup{''} a-lɪnkʊ-sook-a kajamba, i-kʊ-lɪl-a \textup{\lq\lq}hɪhɪhɪhɪɪ, hɪhɪhɪhɪɪ, a-fw-ile, a-fw-ile\textup{''}

src: ijolo n̩-dw-iho lw-a ba-Nyakyʊsa ba-a-lɪ na=a-ka-jɪɪlo k-a n-kiikʊlʊ ʊ-kʊ-n-tiil-a ʊ-gwise gw-a n̩-dʊme, ʊ-jʊ \textbf{tʊ}-\textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{tɪ} n-kamwana
trs: Long ago in the tradition of the Nyakyusa people they had a custom of the woman fearing the father of her husband, whom we call Nkamwana.' [Should she save a life\ldots]

src: ʊ-gwe ʊ-lɪ na=a-ma-lʊndɪ lwele, \textbf{kʊkʊtɪ} kɪ-lʊndɪ k-oog-a a-m-ɪɪsi ɪ-n-dobo jɪ-mo

trs: \lq Then that person begins to get very ill and his body peels like a chameleon.' [Killer woman]

src: po lɪnga a-ba-bʊʊl-ile a-ba-paapi ba-ake pamo ʊ-gwise gw-a n̩-dʊmyana jʊ-la, \textbf{a}-\textbf{a}-\textbf{j}-\textbf{aga} \textbf{kʊ}-n-sʊʊm-ɪl-a kʊ-gwise gw-a n-kiikʊlʊ ʊkʊtɪ \textup{\lq\lq}ʊ-mw-anaako, n-gʊ-lond-a ʊkʊtɪ eeg-igw-ege n=ʊ-mw-anangʊ\textup{''}
trs: \lq When he had told his parents or his father, he [father] would go to the woman's father and ask \lq\lq Your child, I want her to be married to my child.''{}' [Life and marriage long ago]
\lq Did you go and work?' [overheard]

src: bo ka-kɪnd-ile=po a-ka-balɪlo ka-nandɪ Pakyɪndɪ \textbf{a}-\textbf{lɪnkʊ}-\textbf{bʊʊk}-\textbf{a} kʊ-n̩-gʊnda. \textbf{a}-\textbf{lɪnkw}-\textbf{a} \textbf{kʊ}-mmw-ag-a ʊ-n-kasi n=ʊ-n-nyambala ʊ-jʊ-ngɪ mu-n̩-gʊnda mu-la
trs: When a short time had passed, Pakyindi went to the field. He (went and) found his wife with another man in that field.' [Sokoni and Pakyindi]

src: po j-aa-tɪ \textup{\lq\lq}niine n-gʊ-bʊʊk-a bo a-ka-j-a=po maama jʊ-la ʊ-n-kiikʊlʊ.\textup{''} po \textbf{bo} \textbf{jɪ}-\textbf{bʊʊk}-\textbf{ile} ɪɪ-sota j-oope \textbf{j}-\textbf{aa}-\textbf{j}-\textbf{ile} \textbf{kw}-ɪmb-a
trs: \lq Then it [Python] said \lq\lq Me too, I'm going when that woman isn't there.''  ‎‎When the python had gone [to the house], it sang.' [Python and woman]

src: po nsysyɪ j-oope \textbf{a}-\textbf{a}-\textbf{bʊʊk}-\textbf{ile}, \textbf{a}-\textbf{a}-\textbf{j}-\textbf{ile} \textbf{kʊ}-lond-a a-ma-ani. a-al-iis-ile na=a-ma-ani ga-la bo a-gon-ile ʊ-tʊ-lo kalʊlʊ
trs: Skunk also went, he (went and) searched for leaves. He came with those leaves, while Hare was asleep.' [Hare and Skunk]

src: po a-lɪnkʊ-golok-a, a-lɪnkʊ-golok-a. \textbf{a}-\textbf{lɪnkw}-\textbf{a} \textbf{kʊ}-fik-a kʊ-jeng-iigwe kʊ-nunu fiijo. po \textbf{a}-\textbf{lɪnkw}-\textbf{a} \textbf{kʊ}-ba-ag-a ba-lɪndɪlɪli ba-a ka-aja ka-la. ba-lɪnkʊ-n̩-daalʊʊsy-a ba-lɪnkʊ-tɪ \textup{\lq\lq}kʊ-lond-a fi-ki?\textup{''}
trs: \lq She went straight, she went straight. She (went and) arrived at a place well built. She (went and) met the guards of that village. They asked \lq\lq What do you want?''{}' [Throw away the child]

src: kʊkʊtɪ ky-ɪnja n-gw-a kʊ-gy-ag-a ɪ-mi-kambɪlɪ kʊ-mi-gʊnda gy-ɪtʊ
trs: (intended: \lq Every year I go and find damn monkeys in our fields.')}

trs: \lq When she was pregnant, she would eventually give birth to a girl.' [Life and marriage long ago]

src: mw-ilaamwisye ɪ-n-dagɪlo sy-angʊ. ʊ-mw-ana a-ka-bagɪl-a ʊ-kw-end-a kangɪ, \textbf{a}-\textbf{ti}-\textbf{kw}-\textbf{is}-\textbf{a} \textbf{kʊ}-job-a sikʊ kangɪ

src: a-ka-pango a-ka ki-kʊ-tʊ-many-isy-a ʊkʊtɪ tʊ-ng-iib-aga, \textbf{tʊ}-\textbf{ng}-\textbf{iis}-\textbf{a} \textbf{kʊ}-fw-a bo lʊʊ$\sim$lo sy-a-fw-ile ɪ-n-gambɪlɪ si-la
trs: This story teaches us that we should not steal, otherwise we will die [lit. we should not come to die] just like those monkeys died.' [Thieving monkeys]

src: kangɪ ʊ-swɪl-enge=po n=ɪ-n-gʊlʊbe pa-ka-aja ʊkʊtɪ bo g-ʊʊl-iisye ɪ-n-dalama ɪ-syo \textbf{s}-\textbf{iis}-\textbf{e} \textbf{si}-\textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{tʊʊl}-\textbf{ege} ʊ-kʊ-ba-homb-a a-ba-fundi
